title: ICE: librustc/mir/tcx.rs:68: extracting field of non-tuple non-adt: Ty { ty: _ }

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

labels.name: NLL-complete
labels.description: Working towards the "valid code works" goal

body:
An underscore (aka wildcard aka `_`) nested within a type declaration is causing problems for some new code that tries to project out the inner types after normalization is finished. Here is an example ([play](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015&gist=e091f254a2dde87c76362dfaf571b6b4)):

```rust
struct X;
struct Y;
struct Z;

pub fn join<A, B, RA, RB>(_oper_a: A, _oper_b: B) -> (RA, RB)
    where A: FnOnce() -> RA + Send,
          B: FnOnce() -> RB + Send,
          RA: Send,
          RB: Send
{
    loop { }
}

fn main() {
    let ((_x, _y), _z): (_, Z) = join(|| (X, Y),
                                      || Z);
}
```

Original bug report follows

----


Running `cargo test` [here](https://github.com/vitiral/artifact/commit/08fe3ece8f82f4b098d6b999c69f7b94dd095c3f)

````
